The failure that i see is 
```
test(org.apache.zeppelin.interpreter.InterpreterOutputChangeWatcherTest)  Time elapsed: 2.034 sec  <<< FAILURE!

```
This doesnt seem related to my change, but could anyone confirm this?
@prabhjyotsingh Mind to review this ? Thanks
Generally looks good, will test it out in one of my test clusters, and update this thread.
Took me a while to configure `zeppelin.livy.ssl.trustStore` and `zeppelin.livy.ssl.trustStorePassword` but looks good works on my local.

Found "ClassNotFoundException" after applying this fix. This is caused by SparkContext using the first TranslatingClassLoader to deserialize TaskResult.  
Sorry to say that I haven't figure out a solution yet. :sob: 
I'm quite busy with my work recently.

Thanks @prabhjyotsingh , will merge it if no more discussion.

The failed test is not related.

```
Tests in error:

```
Generally, it makes sense to me
Still no news?

Hi @1ambda and @Leemoonsoo ,
Can you have another look at this one?
After rebasing latest master (now contains [ZEPPELIN-2152](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ZEPPELIN-2152)) and squashing my commits, this is the version I would like to get approved.
There is a lot of info. in the above comments. Any question, let me know and thank you.
By the way, I linked [ZEPPELIN-2227](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ZEPPELIN-2227) as duplicate to this one ([ZEPPELIN-2214](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ZEPPELIN-2214)).

Hi @sven0726, Thanks for the contribution. I added a comment. 

- This pr is not related with CI, but if you want to modify code you need to setup travis CI for your zeppelin fork.

Hi @khalidhuseynov!

Thanks for looking into it. Is there a way to support you?
Cool!
Hi @FRosner, I think best way would be to help review and test #932 first. i was going to do it as well, but didn't get much time recently. thanks for help, and i'll check it this week too.

Thanks for the contribution @DrIgor!

Can we apply some theme to the output? For example,

Solarized dark theme + shell syntax highlight. 

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4968473/26560133/0d800262-44ef-11e7-879f-5f46e0317f57.png)

AFAIK, we are using highlight.js

https://github.com/apache/zeppelin/blob/master/zeppelin-web/bower.json#L27
Thanks! @AhyoungRyu :)

Cool!
I'd love the dark theme, but I don't think we should force this onto users?
@zjffdu Could you help review this?

@felixcheung Thanks for the feedback.
Not sure if i got your question.
I will try to elaborate more on the change
The userinfo will give a picture of what is run/being run by whom  and its duration, in the spark application.(Currently, we display **zeppelin**)
The spark web UI will list all jobs, with this user information.

Hi, @simulight. 
If you want to improve zeppelin about your idea, could you create a JIRA ticket?
And, this branch is fault. could you close this PR, please?

I am not sure If themes should be shell interpreter feature. Maybe we can provide themes for every interpreter's text output?

highlight.js should be used for input, not output. Output already contains information about colors and text styles

@necosta Helium feature doesn't work after this PR.

- cloned new zeppelin repository
- built ` mvn clean package -DskipTests;`
- started zeppelin instance
- then got this error.

```
ERROR [2017-05-30 17:23:55,117] ({main} ZeppelinServer.java[<init>]:145) - 
java.lang.NullPointerException
	at java.net.URI$Parser.parse(URI.java:3023)
	at java.net.URI.<init>(URI.java:595)
	at org.apache.zeppelin.helium.HeliumOnlineRegistry.getProxy(HeliumOnlineRegistry.java:123)
	at org.apache.zeppelin.helium.HeliumOnlineRegistry.getAll(HeliumOnlineRegistry.java:71)
	at org.apache.zeppelin.helium.Helium.getAllPackageInfo(Helium.java:190)
```

- style is also a part of feature.
- if we don't need styling for output, then there is no reason to add css code for JDBC output. (table)
- highlight.js is just a library. we can use it to anywhere for delivering, making the best feature.
- if you don't want to include styling in this PR, it's ok. we can improve in the following PR. but Personally, I don't see this is good style. 

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4968473/26579240/f58723c8-456d-11e7-8fa3-358f2a1e98bd.png)

Here are few examples of what shell output should be. And that's the reason why many people customize their shell. 

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4968473/26579286/2685fed6-456e-11e7-8ee9-b5dcd46e836f.png)

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4968473/26579329/44462842-456e-11e7-816d-e9c265b54e50.png)

I thought colorizing is included in this PR. But it's not part of this PR. Please forget about the last comment. I will create another JIRA ticket and work on that issue.

- https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ZEPPELIN-2604

@1ambda , my bad, failing to realize this would not work when no proxies are set. 
I'll keep testing this fix but I think it's ok. Can you test as well?

I understand that `highlight.js` is a library and can be used anywhere. But we can't apply it to shell output because output is already highlighted. For example, `ls` inserts color codes to its output so we need to follow it.

We can provide customization for colors (RGB code for blue, RGB for green and so on) and background color.

Should I add this properties to shell interpreter?

Hi @jongyoul 
Is there some way I can help push this to merge faster?

Thanks @1ambda :+1: 
Let me test it out ASAP!

java.lang.NullPointerException
        at java.net.URI$Parser.parse(URI.java:3023)

Thanks for the contribution @0qtttt.

1. To pass CI, you need to setup travis CI for your zeppelin fork. The forked repository name must be `zeppelin`. 

- https://zeppelin.apache.org/contribution/contributions.html#continuous-integration

2. It would be nicer to add screenshots for **before**, **after**.

@soralee Thanks for updating official page. Could you add `[gh-pages]` prefix to the PR title?

Let me take a look and comment soon.
Thank you, I'm sorry

regarding navbar-collapse button, it would be nice to modify `navbar-inverse. .navbar-toggle` classes style in style.css:L151 to

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4968473/26614909/3643485c-45fe-11e7-9d8b-fda7e5b35974.png)

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4968473/26614913/3be33ede-45fe-11e7-9af1-84e67024dc8c.png)

Setting border color to white would be better. 
For code, you can refer https://github.com/apache/zeppelin/pull/2355

### Before

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4968473/26614977/ba44a1be-45fe-11e7-82cc-5ec6a74401c3.png)
 
### After 

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4968473/26614985/c6597b96-45fe-11e7-9e14-6c485bdd2bd6.png)

Background colors and text styles can be improved. 

### Current

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4968473/26615080/566549e0-45ff-11e7-829f-42b69c2c6240.png)

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4968473/26615374/5ad22258-4601-11e7-9c4c-cda249768939.png)

### After

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4968473/26615066/43f70190-45ff-11e7-8646-b57adcd67b6c.png)

### Code

For title, let's use `text-shadow: 1px 2px #353131` for better readability.

Layout in small browser can be improved too.

### Current

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4968473/26615101/7c0faeec-45ff-11e7-8f03-df01f06e37b6.png)

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4968473/26615106/814abb4a-45ff-11e7-9e9c-33f5de059313.png)

Can we improve the layout this section too? Currently, it looks like

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4968473/26615166/ea1de930-45ff-11e7-871d-b7b049cd78b0.png)

Descriptions (e.g `spark ....`) in the **TECHNOLOGIES** section is too small. It's hard to read.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4968473/26615192/0ec2236e-4600-11e7-97cd-92f79176bfe1.png)

If it's impossible to use specific logos (e.g mysql, postres) due to license for the **SQL** button, IMO we can apply this kind of design. (i know. font is not fancy, but we can improve.)

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4968473/26615335/fae6f512-4600-11e7-8cbc-6e776e69c0d2.png)

Also, icons and texts are slightly moved in a medium size browser. (including the **deployments** section)

### NORMAL: Large Size Browser

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4968473/26615306/c793b4d4-4600-11e7-82ab-b0475c12de2c.png)

### PROBLEM: Medium Size Browser

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4968473/26615302/c2849a3a-4600-11e7-9595-4db55463717a.png)

Can we use a different color for hovered button?

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4968473/26615360/33f46592-4601-11e7-977c-a0da499b4382.png)

Buttons in navbar are not fully hovered. Height should be 60. 
You can refer https://github.com/apache/zeppelin/pull/2355

### Current

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4968473/26615496/3262c376-4602-11e7-9d02-0c4e151e8b51.png)

### After 

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4968473/26615510/55cf91c2-4602-11e7-8cc9-853beb41027a.png)

Hi, all. 
There are many feedback in here so, I've arranged the following TODO list for sharing progress.  

1) in blue section
- [x] add zeppelin logo in the blue section
- [x] fix to bug about misalign apache zeppelin text and icon
- [x] change `Get started` button hover color
- [x] connecting a link to `Get started` button

2) regarding to improve navbar
 - [x] apply style
 - [x] change border color
 - [x] change background color and text style
 - [x] fix : not fully hovered color
 - [x] fix :  when resizing window, drop-menu toggle text is appeared.
 - [x] fix : after using navigation bar in small window, and then drop-toggle place is misaligned in big window.


3) regarding to improve layout
 - [x] when resizing window
 - [x] change multi-user icon
 - [x] improve what's new section


4) in technologies section
- [x] set more bigger text in technologies
- [x] apply sql font
- [x] connecting quick start links


5)  in deployments section
- [x] change title for user setting option (single user, multi user)
- [x] connecting quick start links

I think `r` is missing in `INTERPRETERS` of `.travis.yml`
`INTERPRETERS` is surprisingly an exclusion list @zjffdu https://github.com/apache/zeppelin/blob/master/.travis.yml#L40

I'm improving navigation bar but, I found two bug in navigation bar.
so we should resolve those issues together.
1. when resizing window, drop-toggle is appeared.

Hi all,

tested it and it works. I understood that https://github.com/apache/zeppelin/pull/2182 is on hold because this one is also going to fix it but in a better way? Can we move forward with this one?

@andreaTP That's is intended. It would be converted to be inclusive. 

```
MODULES="-pl $(echo .,zeppelin-interpreter,${INTERPRETERS} | sed 's/!//g')"
```
good point, so I added it to the list, I think it fits the scope of this PR (let see what travis says)

Then can we add documentation including examples? (e.g for Google OAuth, Github OAuth, ,..)

That's because users are having trouble when they setup security things. 
But there is no proper documentation. LDAP is one example. 

So, it would be nice to include documentation like

- How to setup Google OAuth
- How to setup Github OAuth
- ...

@Leemoonsoo I think we don't need to merge this PR into master. because the master branch supports IE9+

```
 "browsers": ["last 5 version", "> 5%", "edge >= 12", "ie >= 9", "safari 7", "chrome 47", "firefox 31"]
```
